intro: Leptorkis gracilis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
